column11: Review Text

column8: Anyone who knows Islan just smiles
column11: Mostly doesn't live up to his nickname Niagara of Sri Lanka....because he looks miserable when he carries little water. Surroundings but beautiful, Devon case makes far

This weir like stepped fall was very pretty but the amount of water flowing across appeared to be very much less in comparison to what we have seen many years ago. It may be due to the controlled release of water from the Upper Kothmale reservoir built by damming across the river that formed St. Clair's falls. From the lookout it was a gorgeous picture.
St. Clair’s Waterfall, often referred to as the “Little Niagara of Sri Lanka,” is one of the most picturesque waterfalls

column8: Waterfall with museum at the view point
column11: When traveling to up country this is one of the many beautiful water falls that you come across. Thiers meusium located at the view point which describes the details of the water fall

Wonderful experience on Hatton, Nuwara eliya Road. This waterfall said to be the widest in Sri Lanka. Have a nice view point in the main road and you can visit a little museum as well. They will explain the story and project related to this waterfall which is a nice experience. Recommended and must see place.

column8: Beautiful Waterfall on the way to Nuwara Eliya via Hatton
column11: This waterfall cascades into two steps. In the rainy season, we can see a wider water stream. This waterfall is one of a very beauitful waterfall in Sri Lanka.
This waterfall is dying due to the Upper Kotmale Project. The water levels are drastically low and the beauty of the fall is vanishing.

St Clair’s is one of the widest waterfalls in Sri Lanka and called the “Little Niagara of Sri Lanka”. Situated close to Talawakele on the Hatton-Talawakele Highway in Nuwara Eliya District and cant be missed so keep your eyes OPEN!
Nice place to relax a bit on the way to or return from Nuwara Eliya via Hatton Road. Very nice environment.
Wonderful location for nature lovers, could take nice pictures. superb view and we really enjoyed the visit.
One of the most beautiful water falls in Nuwara Eliya which can been seen from the Colombo - Hatton main roda.

Anybody who heading to Nuwara Eliya through Hatton-Thalawakele rout may see this mind blowing waterfall which offers an amazing view along with a range of mountains and valleys. This is one of the widest waterfalls in Sri Lanka which is commonly known as the “Little Niagara of Sri Lanka”. By the time we visited, although the water stream has reduced, it reflected its stunning beauty. You can enjoy the view and the beauty from observation platform at the main road. This is a must visit.
View is good when there is a good flow of water on the river. The scenery around is breathtaking. Can be viewed from the main road.
One of the iconic location when travelling towards Nuwara Eliya - Amazing during rainy season as the water flow is much higher.

It is a wide waterfall with not much of a hieght, situated in Nuwara Eliya district. It is even called the Niagara Falls of Sri Lanka due to its wideness. Due to the Upper Kotmale Hydropower Project, the water stream has reduced up to a significant magnitude. That is the only reason I gave it 4 stars. The falls is situated by the Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya main road. You can observe it from the viewing gallery situated by the road. But if that is not enough for you, you can walk down to the waterfall through the tea plantation. But, bathing is not at all recommended there.
This water-fall is visible when you travel in Colombo Nuwara Eliya main road and this is so beautiful.
Steep Hike upto the waterfall. Wish there were better washrooms. Pathway made along most of the way. Good place if you like a small hike and splash of water. But nothing outstanding

It is said to be one of the the most beautiful places in Sri Lanka. We are totally convinced upon visiting the St Clair Tea Plantation Estate with beautiful waterfall where can be watched from multi-tiered viewing platforms. There is a restaurant at the viewing platform too. The landscape in the surroundings and the journey going to this place from Nuwara Eliya are full of beautiful views and greenery. Lovely place and a must visit for nature lovers!!! Hiring driver it’s necessary to this place with approximately an hour drive as we engaged “BLUE HAVEN TOURS” with superb driver called “Mr Sugath”. Two thumbs up to this wonderful place!!!
We visited the falls on our way from Nuwara Eliya. It is in a team estate. The falls have a very good view and it is very serene to admire the nature from here.

Sri lankan niagara falls- widest falls in sri lanka. Beautiful falls from the view point , small steps downwards (not closest to the fall) through out the tea estate. Easy access View point is on the road talawakele - hatton,even from the train also can view on the way also.

Known as the ‘Little Niagara of Sri Lanka’, it is one of the widest waterfalls in the country. It consists of ‘the Greater Fall’ of 80m or 260’ and ‘the Lesser Fall’ of 50m or 160’. The falls are near the Upper Kotmale Dam. The government promised to release a set level of water between sunrise and sunset. The viewing platform is a fair distance away but a zoom lens does the trick.
it's nice to stop when you are on the way.. but no need to make an extra way to see them. It's a Waterfall like many others too but nice for a picture
Great little scenic stop to get out and stretch your legs whilst taking in the view of the waterfall.

Situated in a marvelous location, in a tea estate, along the road to Nuwaraeliya by Thalawakele. This waterfall is visible from the main road as well as from the train line. There are several observation decks on the main road for a better scenic view of the waterfall. However, due to the upper Kothmale reservoir, not much water flow to the waterfall. This reduced the attraction of the waterfall. But, in rainy season, the reservoir opens its sluice gates making a wide and beautiful waterfall.
Obviously very beautiful location way to Nuwaraeliya near by Thakawakele. This is very famous waterfall and travellers are loving St Claire. Rainning season it's become more beauty than others.
You could see the Waterfall when you travel by vehicle or train very close view. it is located in talawakele estate.

This used to be one of the best looking water falls in the country until the water was diverted to a nearby hydro power station. Sometimes based on water availability, they direct water towards the falls and if you are lucky..you can see the waterfall at that time.

It’s situated in Talawakele in Nuwara Eliya district. It derives from Kothmale Oya which is a tributary of Mahaweli river. It is one of the widest waterfalls in Sri Lanka, know as little Niagara. It cascades in three rocks and has two downfalls. It’s a beautiful site one must never miss.

we stopped by the roadside to get some quick snaps of this famous waterfall which looked monstrous because of the rain in the hills. this is one of the many waterfalls you get to see when travelling to nuwara eliya.
It having a nice view and good landscape appearance of the water falls At the time of rain the falls became large Just by standing there you will feel relaxed
The fall is  not that beautiful now as earlier since they have done a minihydro project there. Now there is a Restaurant and a Museum too there.
This waterfall is a famous and one of the beautiful waterfalls in Sri Lanka. Can see on the way to Nuwara Eliya. it is a really nice view with the greenery surrounding.
If you are on your way to Nuwara Eliya you will be passing this amazing waterfall. The viewpoint is awesome and can get the full view of what is offered.
When you travel Nuwara Eliya in a train or any other vehicle you can see this beautiful water fall. Most of the months in the year, it is full with water.
Not much water as it is summer . But all the same a very beautiful sight to behold and a superb spot to admire nature and God's creation

Has lost most of its charm due to water being diverted for the hydro power project. Although viewing platforms have been constructed by the highway and access to view is easy, it was much more glorious in the old days.

Unfortunately I thought because we had heavy rain for an hour in Kandy this would result in increased water flow in the mountains but this was not to be. It is still worth a look to imagine what it would look like with heaps of water coming down.

This waterfall comes down in steps and water for it is diverted for power generation but a certain amount is released even in dry season as this is a major tourist attraction. In rainy season, this looks much better as all excess water flaws down as a huge fall. About 132 kms from Colombo, before which is the Devon falls and the St. Clair's Tea Center where refreshments are served.
This is the real waterfall I saw in this are because having a huge way to watch from the road and from the view point very beautiful even can go near tea plantation and have a good view too

It's an eye-opener to the state of climate change - this beautiful waterfall, which should have been a solid curtain of water, was a bit more than a trickle. Water shortages in the hill country are becoming more acute, earlier and easier on in the year and the state of these beautiful waterfalls is a telling reminder, warning even, that we have the responsibility to care for the environment.

St. Clairs falls is visible from a roadside lookout point on the Hatton-Talawakele road going to Nuwara Eliya. The falls themselves are somewhat diminished to damming upriver but flow should improve with rains. The lookout point is on a blind curve of the road. Be aware of approaching vehicles from both directions if crossing the road to get to the beautiful St. Clairs tea Center located just across from the lookout point. Climbing to few steps to the Tea Center provides a better vantage point to view the falls and also provides the opportunity to purchase tea grown directly on the adjoining St. Clairs tea estate. Delectable. sit down and have a cup on the porch outside and enjoy the view.
VEry close to travel point, nothing very great but the vast expanse of greenery makes it a soothing sight
We called in at the observastion point for these falls on the way down from Nuwara Eliya. You can park and get out on a viewing platform for a couple of scenic photos. 5-10 mins  max stay

Right next to Devon falls another beautiful falls. By to roads there is designated view points. You may visit the museum just one stairs below the view point. You dont have to pay to enter the museum. Tea gardens are all around the place.
Beautiful scenery due to the waterfall.             You can spend time just looking at this. We had a quick snack at the restaurant which gives best scenery of this waterfall..

As you explore the highlands of Sri Lanka you come across many waterfalls, and some of them offer brilliant views of the surroundings. There is safe parking and this attraction is worth stopping for and taking out selfies
There is a parking lot so you can get out safely, get onto a museum roof and have a nice view.  The view of the surrounding area, including the falls, is lovely.
Good falls on the way, has a view point stopover which is good. Great to take a small break and enjoy the view

this is the one of the best waterfall in nuwaraeliya. one of the amazing place to the relax..with this view point have nice restaurant and when i am sitting there tables on the corridor i feel fresh and cool air.i will highly recommend this place as a best tourist attraction

This is one of the best falls in an around hatton ..you should treck down to the fall..it is in center of a tea estate...the place is mesmerizing..we went in rains it was so lovely There is a restaurant near this fall..just enjoy nice tea ..
You will find plenty of waterfalls in nuwara eliya and this one is among the famous one. Beautiful location in the hills to relax
Viewed from a conveniently constructed roadside viewpoint. Not as awe inspiring as Devon Falls, but still a spectacular sight and a must see on the way to Nuwara Eliya.
There are some really great waterfalls around nuwara eliya and this one is one of the most famous one ..

We saw this waterfall from a distance and i have seen all the pictures and it looked somewhat different to what i have seen before. This may be because there was heavy rain during the last few days so water may have got muddy. Overall its a free sight on the side of the road, on your way to Nuwara Eliya.
The waterfall is nice, but we mostly enjoyed the drive on the winding road past the various tea fields, really pretty area.

These majestic “St.Clairs” falls are close to the main road from Avissawella to Nuwara-Eliya and can well be seen from the Main Line rail track close to Talawakelle. It falls down in two cascades and is an inviting site for regular bathers because it is fairly easily reacheable from a footpath ( actually there are many ) downhill through greeny tea shrubbery. Named after a British colonist, these are one of two waterfalls threatened by a proposed hydro-power scheme in the area.
There is a viewing point of the waterfall by the road. Across the road, there is a tea shop with cakes.
good and very attractive waterfall to admire very beautiful location tea fields good carpet roads huge mountain range
Can see from highway. Definitely worth a short shot to view. Can easily take pictures from parking area.
From the main road itself, situated at Tawalatenna, St. Clair's is known as the Sri Lankan Niagara falls. Breathtaking view and a beautiful surrounding.
This waterfall is located in the Nuwara eliya and Awissawella road. You can't reach closer  and touch water. there is a viewing point.From there you can see the beauty of the fall
You can get some nice views of the falls from the Road. Nice place to take a break whils travelling south from Kandy.
You can view this beautiful water fall by the road side. A good stop on the way.A scenic area must stop and enjoy.
We did not walk to the waterfall - did not know it was possible. However beautiful stop and beautiful waterfall seen from the road.
Was raining, so couldn't take full advantage.  beautiful green area.  accessibility was not a problem.
Beautiful waterfalls.  Must be seen when the full flow of water is at its peak.  We were less fortunate but still worth the drive from Nuwara Eliya.

St.Clares and Devon's water falls are situated in one of the scenic places on earth. opposite of the waterfalls is the Mlesna Ttea outlet. You can reach this waterfall when you are travelling from Hatton to Thalawakele. View from the train is un explanerble. .
A very beautiful water fall along the way to Nuwara-Eliya Unfortunately less water due to the hydroelectric power station but still looks stunning.

Situated on the way to Hatton this water falls has beautiful view of the valley, the view point is very far from the actual falls, still a attraction to look out for. you do not get any facilities or food around apart from some street vendors.
Is visible from the motorway. A quaint hotel across the motorway gave a good view of the water fall. Worth a visit.
Do not miss the chance to visit this waterfall. You can see this from the main road you are traveling. No need to go nearby. These are the reason to love Sri Lanka

Very scenic and you can get fantastic view of the waterfall at a long distance due to observation point constructed in 2015 by Mahinda government. With the devepments done by previous government, Food court, wash room, souvenir shop is in operation and if you go to the restaurant you can have your food while admiring the charming , romantic site of waterfall.
There is no doubt that this is a great sight and scenic beauty but sadly you can experience from a great distance only.
This is a nice waterfall to stop and look at and take some pics while on the way to Nuwara Eliya. Beautiful view!
This was a great waterfall near the road on the route from Nuwara Eliya. Worth the stop but don't spend too long here as there are so many views along the way.

Found on the main road to Hatton. This has separate view point and can also go closer to the fall via steps and if you do have the strength to go and come back. Its a quite lengthy walk. There is a close by Tea Shop to purchase good tea and have some with hot short eats.
I think St Clair's Falls is a must, the scenery is both refreshing and breathtaking and make a really good background for photos.
You can have a look at the falls from the main road. A viewing platform is recently added with a café hence you can have a small break there as well.
Good view from the highway of this reasonably broad falls. A little further along the road a narrower but higher falls in also seen well from the road.
While on tour we stopped at these falls and got some great photo's and then sat back in the nearby tea-house and took in the lovely views.
Very nice falls. They have built a building where the best view point is and there is a little museum in that building. Don't miss this it's very educational for kids and adults.
its a cool place and its suitable to travel with your family, friend or solo its a very beautiful place and you can see the clear view from the main road.
Our driver stopped so we could get some really good photos, was not disappointed the waterfalls on the trip were so amazing.
Woahhhh such a beautiful location with nice view.. This is one of the most beautiful waterfalls can find around Nuwara Eliya..
A beautiful view - picturesque. There is a tea shop across the road which sells a variety of tea to choose from.

One can visit this waterfall on the way from Nuwara Eliya to Bentota. A beautiful place for view of waterfalls, tea gardens, mountain railway together. The Viewing spot also offers local pineapple, war mango from local vendors with mouthwatering spices.
Easy to take photos of this lovely waterfall from the roadside. The St Clair Falls are on the same road as the Devon Waterfalls - very close together - only short car ride between the two.
During our journey from Nuwara Eliya to Colombo, we did en route visit to St Clair's fall and it was a great and refreshing site.

This is nothing more than a sight that you can see on the way. This is not something you have to take a journey to see. This is quite easily visible from the main road. Its a nice scenic spot for nature lovers and photographers.
A beautiful water fall, which was flowing due to heavy rains,which made it more beautiful. A must see on a trip to Nuwara Eliya. You can see it from the roadside. Lovely for photographs.
This is probably the most scenic and accessible waterfall of the many you will see along the Hatton-Talawakele Hwy.

St. Clair waterfalls located at  St. Clair estate of Thalawakele. You could see this beautiful waterfall even by your train tour or else very closely if you are travelling by a vehicle. I have experienced both and love the  view of it.
One of the most beautiful waterfalls you find around Nuwara Eliya, close to the main road, visible from the road itself
This picturesque water fall is located on the Hatton- Nuwara Eliya road. There is a good viewing point with parking.
This waterfall is situated on the Hatton - Nuwara Eliya road. The view point is well maintained with ample parking.
clair and doven fall a must go..if u r coming from kandy..you must stop here... loved the scenery 😍😍😍

Our driver stopped at St Clair's Falls on our way back to colombo. Wow what a view. The scenary is breathaking. Across the road was a beautiful tea shop which sold some of the tea St Clair's tea factory produces. Proper parking spaces and not just at the side of the road. If you get a chance stop here and soak up the lovely views
You can treak to the waterfall but wear good shoes. I took a tuk-tuk up to 2/3 height. After that access only by foot. Worth the effort. Don't forget a rain jacket.
We stopped here by chance on our way around Sri Lanka. Beautiful waterfall with fantastic lush, green scenery. Worth a stop to have a look.

We made a quick pit stop on our drive from Hatton to the train station in Nuwara Eliya. While we only saw St. Clair's Falls from a distance we could still appreciate the beauty. Great quick and scenic stop!
Located in Hattion - Nuwara Eliya road. There are place to observe the same. Nice landscape. Flowing of Watter of the fall may very during the seasons based on water flows.
We had a great time looking at the falls and also having a cup of freshly made tea! Great place to stop and have a nice look at the water fall, it is breathtaking!

This beautiful water fall is located on the Hatton Nuwara eliya road  where there is a platform built for viewers to watch it comfortably. During the rainy season the fall flows in full force giving a panoramic view . By the side f the platform there is a museum like building where the entire geography in and around the water fall has been displayed as an exhibit giving details of the Upper Kothmale reservoir , the power station and many other details. If you travel by train, you could have a very beautiful view not only of the water fall but the reservoir and the supporting ponds. If you are traveling to Nuwara eliya by motorway or by train through Nanuoya railway station , it should be made a point to keep your cameras ready  to shoot the panoramic view.
This is an another beautiful waterfall on the way to Nuwaraeliya. This close to the Devon falls. Easily watch and photograph from the by the side of the road.

One of the many waterfalls you see when you are driving towards Nuwara Eliya; when the weather is good you can stop along the road to make some nice pictures. It is, however, not possible to visit this waterfall.
One of the most famous falls in SL. Doesn't have the amount of water it had running through it as there is a dam up in the river.
Unexpected Great view , beautifull and all..worth passing by ( anyways since its onee the way down from nuwara ) . Still its not magistic in size...its just picturistic

Srilanka is a place for many waterfalls. St. Clair's Falls is one of the falls. Falls depend on the season and timing of the Dams. This was created when the Kotmale Hydro Power Plant Dam was built. A lovely view from the view point. The roads that lead to the dams are too good. Beautiful smooth and very winding roads. Lots of places to photograph. The tea gardens surrounding the falls are lovely. There are some lovely cottages/hotels which overlook the falls and they must be getting wonderful views. Though it rained everyday but the water on the falls were not vast. Still it looked beautiful. The view points had several floors and one can easily get down to the tea gardens and other places for taking photographs. During the rainy season, one has to be careful with the leaches in the garden, and in the bush. No entry fee needed.

This is one of the most scenic waterfalls in Sri Lanka. There will be leeches during the wet season. Please make sure to carry an insect repellent if you walk towards the waterfall. This location can be accessed by public transport. Please be aware of unauthorised travel agent conman. Always organise your trips with the hotel you stay or use public transport. The public transport weren't that great.

A beautiful stop to photograph and admire these falls if passing them , en route to the Hill-country. There's a tea stop for a break, perhaps with a nice cup of Sri Lankan tea.  A must if passing them.

The flow of water is significantly less than it normally is due to the closing of the damn but this still doesn't take away the stunning beauty and view of the falls. This is a must see on your way to Nuwara Eliya.
Breathtakingly beautiful, saw one of many similar to this and they were all fantastic... SLR at the ready.
We saw the falls from quite far off but they looked very impressive. We had lunch at the viewpoint. It was OK, but not much choice. The view was excellent.
Unlike the other falls this is falling in steps and it is quite broad and looks like milk flowing down .. very nice view

It was sorry to see the present condition of the St Clair’s Fall. I haven’t been to this area for the past 10 years but felt very sad to see the minute flow of water through the fall. It was one of the most beautiful water falls in the country round the year with a huge flow of water flowing across it, but with the upper Kotmale hydro plant dam it has now become a skeleton which flows water only during day time     Now we have to wait until the next high rainy season to see this beauty at her full flow again.
We stopped enroute from Nuwara Eliya to view the falls. The water levels were low at the time so the falls were not very spectacular.
I had my lunch in tea castle while enjoying the waterfall from a little bit far away. I did not get close to it but it seems nice
Nuwara eliya one of the stunning city in Sri Lanka .This water fall is 80 m high and a must see place in Sri Lanka
We didn't go close to the falls but stopped at a viewing point. Worth seeing. I'm not sure how close you can get.

Very beautiful waterfalls on the Hatton - Nuwara Eliya road, near Talawakele.  Great view point and rest area built a few years ago, also includes a small "museum" that provides information on the Upper Kotmale Hydropower Dam that has been built upstream from the falls.  Also a small restaurant there.  Definitely worth a stop!
Very beautiful water fall can be seen on our way to Nuwara Eliya via Hatton.  Beautiful once the water level is high or rainy season.

During the rainy season, this area is an emerald gem!  There are a couple of places to stop and have a cup of tea and cake.  The views are spectacular.  I keep finding myself back to this place, still after 14 years of annual visits to the country.
We were on a tour bus en route to the Pedro Tea Gardens and stopped to photograph this lovely part of the local scenery. It's not a "knockout" but it is quite beautiful.

This is supposed to be one of the best if not the best waterfalls view in South Asia, unfortunately, they have constructed a dam on the higher stream of the river the water flow got reduced and you get very less water on the falls, hence her beauty had gone. Even now you can find she is really charming and breathtaking.
Some of the best views of any of the multiple waterfalls in the tea trails area.  I wish I had hiked in the area.

The falls were lesser than we expected based on pictures seen before, but that may be partly due to the weather, as well as partly to do with the Dam construction upriver (play on words intended). Nice enough spot for taking pictures.

Our guide explained that the large hydroelectric plant only a mile or so upstream had hugely reduced the water flow. One can understand why Sri Lanka felt the need for such a project but , looking st pre dam photos, the impact is sizeable turning a major attraction into one that is pleasant. Progress?

Stopped on the road side viewing area for nostalgic reasons, didn't realize how far away the falls actually are. The lack of rain and less water flow only made it worse. Still a beautiful water fall in a picturesque surround.

This site is good for taking photographs but the waterfall was not very exciting. It was far and seems not too big. Maybe because the height of this point is more than that of waterfall. As this takes only 10-15 mins, you can take a stop while traveling from Nuwara Eliya to Bentota
Well it wasnt exactly what I expected, probably coz the water level was minimum.. The watrefall wasnt wide as it used to be.. But well, it was nice..
A lovely view in fantastic countryside. A perfect photo opportunity from a stopping point nearby. I understand it's even better when the water is more prominent
Even though we viewed these falls in a very dry period of weather they still looked spectacular. It is easy to see the falls from the main road so you don't have a long walk to enjoy them.

St. Clair's Falls is one of the widest waterfalls in Sri Lanka. Many people call it as the "Little Niagara of Sri Lanka" because of its shape is very similar to Naigara Waterfall. The falls are situated almost 3 KM west of the Talawakele on the Hatton-Talawakele Highway. St. Clairs waterfall cascades over three rock outcrops into a large pool running through a gorgeous tea estate. The waterfalls consist of two falls called "Maha Ella" - The Greater Fall -  which is almost 80 meters high and 50 meters wide and "Kuda Ella" - The Lesser Fall - which is 50 meters high and located immediately downstream of the main fall. According to the records, St Clair's falls are the 20th highest waterfall in Sri Lanka. Though its not very high, but the glory comes with the wideness of the Waterfall. In the rainy season, it is great sight to see the St. Cairs. Even you are traveling from the train, you can see the waterfall. But I recommend you to visit there by vehicle then you can enjoy the sight and feel the environment. The sad thing is, the waterfall affected by the Upper Kotmale Hydro Power Project. St. Clairs waterfall is no longer the St. Clairs which previously known. For the benefit of the public a limited quantity of water will be released to prevent complete disappearance of the fall, but that amount of water is not enough to bring the former glory, but still the sight you can get is exceptional. There are enough space for parking and some local guys are selling fruits/vegetables for reasonable price.
We stopped by here after a long drive. It was worth it as it was an amazing view. Very good spot for a selfie or a group photo if that is your thing.
Nothing much to write. Its a 5 min stop on your way back from Nuwara Eliya. Looks pretty and makes for a decent picture.

Perfect stop to stretch the legs and admire the view from the main road opposite the falls with an impressive outlook Part of the attraction was the energetic boy tempting us to buy delicious mango from a roadside stall which we couldn't refuse. After the mango sale he pulled out a variety of souvenirs to sell. Points for trying.
You should not miss this spectacular scenery when you travel from Colombo to Nuwaraeliya on Talawakelle Road.
St. Clairs Water fall adds beauty to the locality. The area has a car park for passers by to stop & photograph the scenery. A nice place to take a breather while on a long trip

Nice falls but water seemed scarce at the time of my visit. It is close to Nuwara Eliyia and very close to the Devon waterfalls as well. The scenery around the falls and all the tea tress make it a pretty site for some pictures despite the low water volume. There are stairs that seem to take you down closer to the falls, I doubt they would take you all the way there, but I didn't try. These falls shouldn't be a destination on their own, but definitely nice to see if you are in the area.
En route out of nuweriya eliya we stopped at the viewpoint . Nice pretty waterfall worth a quick stop...

You will see the fall from the street. Although small, it is very beautiful. It is surrounded by grass land. There is a small path that supposedly go to the waterfall but the path actually stop somewhere in the middle. The view there is actually less beautiful than the view from the street. So what I am saying is: no point to go down that path.
It will be great if one could go closer to it. But from distance it looks beautiful and large. This is one of many water falls in this city.

This was once a very beautiful waterfall, until the construction of the Upper Kotmale Dam. Since then very less water is available. Not as beautiful as before. Situated by Hatton - Nuwara Eliya road one will not miss this waterfall. Observation points are constructed. But if one wants to go closer, can take a journey through tea estates. but not easy.

This is a breathtaking place while traveling to Nuwara Eliya (know as Little England). There is a viewing gallary located along the road side to take beautiful pictures. One of the key waterfalls in Sri Lanka
These falls tumble over a set of rocks before dropping into a pool which produces another waterfall. Set in a scenic area amongst the tea plantations resulting in a lovely photo opportunity.
We stopped at this location to enjoy the scenery and the good view with the waterfall in the background. The place was very packed with many young people taking selfies.

St. Clair's Fall is Often described as the Little Niagara Falls of Sri Lanka for it's Width. It's a beautiful waterfall surrounded by the lush green mountains. Getting a glimpse of the waterfall all the way from the Observation Area is truly not enough. Sometimes people are allowed to go near the fall, unfortunately the day we went the path was blocked for maintanence. It's a famous photo-stop for tourists travelling in the area and many tour busses and couches do make a stop here.
A very scenic but small waterfall. We saw it from the point made for the purpose. We could see a few people in water. But I wonder if it is worth the trouble as it is very small.

A very long trip from anywhere in the world   But worth it The weather is heavenly Paradiso Getting close to the waterfalls is not easy for families The valley is cutting your way but you still can get very close This is one of the best places I saw in srilanka Highly recommended
it is enough to see from far as i did. quite. I love the nearby tea restaurant and shop. give it a try.
The Saint Clair's water falls offer a picture perfect view  amidyst of the lush green mountains. A nice location for photography too.

Compared to other waterfalls in Sri Lanka, this is a smaller and average attraction. You can use the viewing gallery maintained by Ceylon Electricity Board situated on Hatton -Nuwara Eliya road to have the best view of this waterfall. From what I have heard from environmental activist, this waterfall is diminishing and charm is lost due to surrounding hydro power plants and various other development activities. Nevertheless, I would still recommend this to nature lovers and road trippers.
you can see the falls while you are on the way, so yes looks almost like a milk falling. No pain in stopping by the road to see this
location of this fall is very attractive. Perfect place to spend your time. The beauty of this falls gets enhanced due to the plantations around. Very beautiful place.

This was once a really beautiful waterfall that was known as the "Little Niagara of Sri Lanka" but is now quite small thanks to a hydroelectric project that has curtailed the flow of water. St Clair's Falls was apparently the widest waterfall in Sri Lanka and has 2 drops, totalling about 74 metres. It is on St Clair tea estate, both of which were named after the wife of the first pioneer tea planter's son, a beautiful lady whose name was Clair. The waterfall is at an elevation of 1,200 metres and is part of the Kotmale Oya. It can be seen from the Hatton to Talawakelle road.
As you travel from Nuwara Eliya towards Colombo one can see this waterfall. Not a very large one, but quite scenic. Good for a pit-stop on the winding ghat roads
Another beautiful stop along the way back to Colombo. Worth a stop and a break from travel.  It's a beautiful car ride along this road.

We stopped off on the way from Hatton to Nuwara Eliya. I probably wouldn't go all the way just to see this but definitely worth the stop. Totally breath taking. There is also St Clair's tea stop opposite. We didn't have time to stop but looks like an amazing place to stop off for a cup of chai. With amazing views.
Breathtaking view and on a clear day photos are great. The beggars appear from nowhere but they are harmless just looking for a little something to help them make it through another day
St Clairs waterfall was one of the most beautiful places which i have seen in Sri lanka i wish i had a house there with this waterfall view You feel yourself in heave
The falls are located in lush country but the falls itself is not that fantastic. Has its own beauty but there are others that are more amazing.
It is a popular stop along the way to Nuwara Eliya. Although it is quite far away, it offers a fantasic view and a good photo spot.
Try to spend atleast an half hour at this place. It is quite romantic and tranquilling place to visit.

We visited the St. Clair's falls on our way to Nuwara Eliya , the fall was with muddy water as it was raining upcountry. One of the best views available when mist is around lightly. Recommend visitors to visit during February - April (during the spring season)

If you take the road via Hatton to Nuwara Eliya this is one of the spectacles you can enjoy. (Not the route via Kandy). One of the widest waterfalls of Sri Lanka, clearly visible from the main road. If you need to go closer you need to trek through the forest.
This is a nice place for a break. You can spent little time with your kids and have a short break. For me, it has its own charming beauty!!

We were told that a recent power project have made the water levels of st Claire falls to be less than normal. Most certainly the waterfall isn't what the picture show but it's a wonderful sight nonetheless .
This beautiful water fall one can see when you travel on the Hatton-Talawakele road.  It a nice location get a selfie.
View from the view balcony is so nice. We met a nice person at the museum there. Explained everything well. Got a clear idea about the project of Kothmale.

St.Clair's falls viewpoint is a stopover on your way down to Colombo from Nuwara Eliya. We stopped by here early morning at 6 and had this wonderful view. The falls though didn't have much water flow at that time. The view of the valley with the waterfall in the centre is breathtaking. The step like falls would look even more beautiful with full waterflow. It's really worth taking a stopover!

Definitely this is one of beautiful place to stop when you travel Hatton_Thalawakele_Nuwaraeliya road. It's very beautiful when it's raining. And also some time s you weren't be able to see the beauty of it as the river was block at Thalawakele by dam and release water time to time. Good place for photographers.
after the power station water level is very low, if you visit in rainy season it's possible to enjoy waterfall,
you get to see the waterfall from far but the view is just breathtaking and feels good to hear the sound of water and even beautiful photographic place

En-route to Colombo from Nuwara Eliya , St. Clair's Falls observation point is a must stop for admiring the beauty and also for stretching ones legs over cups of coffee . Its beauty is enhanced by the lush greenery around it . There is also a small museum above the restaurant but it was closed when we visited .
One of the beautiful waterfall in Sri Lanka. Best view from the road. Specially you can see the beauty form the point of St Clair's Tea Center. Rare view. Unforgettable memory
Surely a place to stop on your way. It's more prettier during the rainy season when the dam gates are opened. You can go down the step near the falls for a better experience
One of the very beautiful waterfalls in Sri Lanka. Its a must to stop if your travelling you way to the hill country. Perfect weather and an amazing scenery. Good for photographers, artists etc etc.

Beautiful waterfall. ...among lush green hills covered with mist....a sight which you will remember for a very long time....u can see this even on a rainy day where other waterfalls dissappear in the misty. ...
Most scenic place for a stopover and clicking some pics. Picturesque scenes like this makes ideal postcards.
This is a lovely waterfall which can be seen from the Nuwara Eliya - Hatton main road. There is a view point to be used by the visitors.

The perks about this tea shop is its location. It is situated right opposite Devons Fall so it has its own viewing deck which overlooks the beautiful fall and the valley of Nuwara Eliya.  St Clairs, a brand which is already familiar to me before my visit here, but never knew about its origin. Here we are, at the centre of where it originates from (for its Ceylon Tea). The tea shop has its own charming garden, where you can have a sip of tea overlooking the beautiful Devons Fall. It is here where we bought our most craved crafted tea that I first encountered during my stay in The Westin Palace Madrid. This tea is really special whereby all the tea leaves and some flowers are being crafted by hand, so that you brew it in a hot water, it blossoms into a pretty flowers. In this case, a rose. It is probably the most expensive. Not only the fact that it is artistically handcrafted, but it is also made out of the highest quality tea leaves – which is the silver tip and golden tip tea leaves. We got it here for 1800Lakhs (RM60) for only 6 pieces. This tea centre is more accurately located at Tawakelle. It is the perfect stop over especially if you are on route between Colombo – Nuwara Eliya. It is not as big as Macwood and Bluefield but it sure has its own old planter’s charm from 100years ago. After a massive tea shopping here (and our last tea shopping for this trip), we continued our journey to Hakgala Botanical Garden.

Sri Lanka is a country rich with waterfalls once again on our way from Nuwara eliya we had a halt on the highway facing st.clair's waterfall. It got its name from a tea estate located near it. and all those waterfalls are almost in central province of sri lanka near nuwara eliya which is thousands meters above the sea level and the weather is almost rainy.
another beautiful falls in the midst of green rich hills . its a sight of behold and click goreat pictures with your loved onces .
You can refresh yourself after a long journey , if you are heading to NÉliya from Hatton side. You can walk towards the Falls from the  Museum.

I visited St clairs falls in Feb 16 on the way to nuwara eliya from colombo via the avissavela & hatton road. The falls are beautiful & scenic like any other waterfall and is a must stop place if you are on the way to nuwaeliya. There is a nice viewing platform constructed right in front of the falls where you can enjoy the view take some pics and just soak in the atmosphere. We visited the place on a sunny day & there were many small vendors selling food items and tea for refreshments. May be on a rainy day the view would be more breathtaking with more gushing water. Tip - plan to visit the place on a rainy day
Another lovely waterfall which could be beautifully seen on the train when passing by on your way to Ella/Nuwara Eliya..
Attractive place to take a break while travelling to Nuwara Eliya. you can have a delicious  chocolate cake with any kind of SL tea while this watching this place. Surrounded my beautiful mountains
We saw the falls at a distance from the train. It was very nice. It adds a beautiful dimension to the neat terraced tea gardens. It's a treat to the train travelers.
It is on the road between Nuwara Eliya to Bentota and you will automatically spent 30 mins with out a word after watching this. in early morning it is worth watching.
Lovely views from the turrets of the St Clair tea factory in Talawakele, visited in April, but in rainy season they must be very impressive
It was an amazing waterfall to view from the top, unfortunately when I went I couldn't go down the stairs to get a closer look as someone had started a fire and a security person stopped me.
You see the falls from a area right on the expressway. Good to stop for some time and take pics. Extremely close to Devon falls and can be covered in the same route.
majestic, ask your driver to show you how you can reach the bottom of the fall. amazing feeling... one of the best spots in hatton
The cool highlands with their tea plantations so lush and much cooler than the coastal areas. I experienced several rain showers with beautiful rainbows.

Excellent view giving on the Falls, as well as the unlimited Green surrounding....with a Blue sky and luckily some clouds (which are not at all rare in Srilanka), you will just travel in your dreams.. This places gives simply a unique splendid view

Visited the falls after almost 10 years and was saddened to see the impact of 'development' - a dam and power station up stream. The fall called the bridal veil for its full flow of water now but a trickle and that too shut down by the dam at night we were told. A new observation site displays the current trickle!!

Having read about this waterfalls in internet, had lot of hopes on this waterfall.We felt amazing once we reached this place to see the beauty. The waterfall is not very roaring and all. But it is very scenic, surrounded by lot of greenery. It has power project team sitting over there to explain about the flow of water from this waterfall and also their power generation techinques. This is worth a visit.

we stopped at St. Clair's tea factory had tea in the restaurant just opposite this viewpoint. it was a lovely place the waterfalls though were very far but it was very beautiful as surrounded by lovely green hills. we stayed here for some time enjoyed the scenes took photos. Nice place to stay for half and hour or so.
this is a nice a waterfall surrounding with beautiful tea estate. worth full spending a day for sight seen.

I stopped here while travelling from Hatton to Nuwara Eliya and don't even wanted to move. It was such a beautiful to just keep watching the beautiful scenery around. On the roadside, there is also a nice view point with a restaurant. Everything on this road (A7) is just beautiful and one should just drive around this area to enjoy the nature.
Has a great view, with is accessible on a timely basis, going down the stairs across the restaurant has a great experience of the water fall.
Just a viewing place at side of the road, but definitely worth stopping. Imagine more spectacular in wet season.

There are a few spots around the area for pictures with waterfalls.  This is the only one we stopped that had a dedicated area for taking pictures.  Make sure you take the stairs down to a lower viewing area if you want a different picture.

St. Claire falls was stunning amid the green hills. The surrounding hills are also so breath taking . The sunlight and the shadow playing on the green tea plants is magical. There is a peace and quiet in the viewing pavilion , which transports us to a Zen like state.
Closed to Talawakelle Town. You can see it from the Hatton Nuwaraeliya main road. Beautiful waterfall in Sri Lanka

St Clair's Falls is very on the route to Nuwara Eliya. It's a beauty that you will cherish always. It's really green and all around and beautiful. The crystal clear water and the charming sound of water fall will mesmerize you.
Got a nice view of the falls. Excellent one. Could not get to see it close by though. Nice view among the Tea Gardens.

Actually Devon and St Clair's Falls are nearby. While Devon falls are higher, St Clair's Falls are nices. You can easily see the waterfall from the road between Hatton and Nuwara Eliya. You also have a wonderful view on the Falls from the nearby Waterfall Resor, however this place is heavily overpriced!
Lovely water fall with great views from the top.The beauty of the falls has gone down a bit due to the dam construction restricting water flow.

We visited a bunch of waterfalls, all in the same day and this was by far the most scenic. Although it has partially dried up, it's still beautiful and you can take pictures from a viewing cabin (free).
You can't get close to these falls but there is a good road side viewing area which is great for some very scenic photos of a very nice water falls.
one of the large waterfalls in this area. no near acess. cab be viewed from the view point. couple of waterfalls nearby.
One of nature's best creations. The falls were full with water (due to rains the past few days) and was a true treat to the eye. Loved it!
Certainly well worth a visit along the Hatton-Talawakele Highway, even just to take a few pictures, however, you will need a car to get there.

Visited on the way from Nuwara-eliya to Hatton that offered a chance to view the falls and scenic surroundings from the look out points. The younger crowd walked right down to the foot of the falls. The falls were at reduced capacity possibly due to a dry spell in the area  (rain was plentiful every where else!).

The St. Clair's fall is known as Little Niagara of Ceylon and Was told by guide it is  80 m high. This is one of the Sri Lanka's highest falls. The water fall is a wide one. The St. Clair's Falls are part of the river Kotmale Oya and can be watched while driving down Kandy to Nuwara Eliye

This is the widest Sri Lankan water fall and probably the most beautiful one and one of the personal bests. It's majestic looks and serene beauty is now limited by the modern day amnesties. Now the water is not flows all day long through this place; One a selected time the water has been released because of Kotmale electricity project. Now you have to be lucky to see the real beauty of it by be there at the right time.
On the route from Nuwara Eliya to Galle Fort stopped at the St Clair's Falls viewing platform, the falls and the surrounding tea plantations are a beautiful sight.

This is the on the way place, Sri Lanka Electricity Board produce electricity from this water falls. viewing gallery gives you a good option for photography if you have pasion of photography, otherwise also it's worth visiting as it's on the way you don't need to go specially to visit this.
Its another beautiful waterfall in Nuwara eliya, even from the road or from Nanu oya railway station you get the chance to watch this

This wasn't the best I had seen but I can vouch for the drive to the place. The drive with tea estates on both sides is lovely. Part of the drive is through a city followed by tea gardens again. There is a viewing point but the waterfall looked brown and muddy....maybe because it rained a lot the day before . Overall I would recommend this place only for the drive.
Beautiful waterfall ! You can have a good view from the viewpoint but if you go down a little you will see the real beauty surrounded by tea plantation,
Another of the many water falls which can be easily sen from the road. Absolutely beautiful making a great photo stop !
This beautiful waterfall is also known as Little Niagara of Sri Lanka. It is lovely, as are the scenery around it, but the waterfall itself is pretty far from the highway.

On your way to Nuwaraeliya this wider waterfall gives you a nice view. There are two tea centers near by. St Clare's tea center and Mlesna Tea center. We had tea and chocholate cake at St Clare's tea center and had a very good view of the fall and also took nice grup photos with the fall in the background.
a resort name Waterfall resort (worst place to stay) has the view of this waterfall,never stay there

The Electricity Board has built a viewing platform (no charge) by the road-side. Unfortunately the flow of water has been reduced by the building of the Kotmale Dam last year. Yet the falls are beautiful and set in scenic surroundings.
This is excellent place and any one needs to see this beauty of nature. This is locate beside the road towards to Colombo to Nuwaraeliya. Place visit this place

Stopped as we were heading back to Colombo. The waterfall is amidst picturesque surroundings. Really loved it. What was even awesome was sipping cuppa tea at St Clair's Tea centre just beside the road.
A more flatter and wider falls than Devon falls. Beautiful! There are two tea centers near by. St Clare's tea center and Mlesna Tea center.

I am traveling alone and I sow lots of reviews here tripadviser about this place I didn't want to see it from the train or jeep so I took the train to Talawakele and then took Tuk Tuk to St. Clair Falls it beautiful falls, worth the time, the Tuk Tuk takes about 6m ride and I pay 300LKR and also you can easily drive to Devon Fallsit take 3 m on Tuk Tuk and you don't have to pay more even.
We see this waterfall on our way to Nuwara elliya through Hatton road. During the rainy season this is really nice. Can see from the main road.

A much photographed scenic water fall on the way to misty Nuwara Eliya. The busy road, from where the fall could be enjoyed, is quite narrow and visitors who stop by are advised to exercise caution when enjoying the lovely scenery surrounded by the green tea estates.
You can't find such clean and fresh nature. It is one of the best places I visited. Advice all to go.
Check out the view point which overlooks the St. Clair's waterfall .... Again stunning views. Do not miss it.

There are some worldwide famous falls like Niagara, Iguaçu and Victoria falls; then you have hundred and hundred falls in all place of the world that are just... falls. St. Clair's Falls (almost in front of the St. Clair's Tea Factory) and Devon falls are just two more falls.

I had a pleasant view of this from the train en route to Badulla. It lacks the beautiful rainforest scenery of so many waterfalls in Philippines, but still was enjoyable to see. The train offers a higher vantage point than the road, another reason why travelling by Sri Lankan railways and not expensive hired car is the way to go.

Searching for the usual place where we stop for some strong tea at the view of Devon falls, we ended in stopping at St. Claire falls view for a change. This is also known as local Niagara falls and when you observe the fall, this is wider than any other falls in Sri Lanka. The place was too cold by 6 PM but it was fantastic. We had our tea at the restaurant that views St Claire and relaxed for some time before we resume to Nuwara Eliya. Never miss this place on your way to Nuwara Eliya.
Nice falls. there is a small restaurant here and one see the falls from a distance, though flow of water has fallen due to insufficient rain falls in th season.

We have a lot a waterfalls in Australia but none that I have seen could ever match the majesty of this place, its truly a little slice of heaven, we had the pleasure of having lunch at the resturant with the falls in the background all I can say is it don't get much better than that.

when you are coming down from nuwara eliya to Colombo via hatton,avissawella you find this beautiful water fall.. cannot go that close but its truly a magnificent creation of nature. can spend hours staring at it while listing to the sound of falling water..
St Clair's falls is very beautiful this time of year, although we couldn't see the top of it due to the low lying mist. Very serene place. Take time to sit and enjoy the tranquility of the place.

Stunning views of the fall capture you as soon as you get the first glimpse from the road. You are attracted to reach for it. You can climb down the stairs path to get closer. A must visit in Nuwara Eliya.
This used to be a beatiful waterfall along the main road.Nowadays has very little water due to Upper kotmale hydro power plant. But can have a look at while visiting devon falls

Very beautiful waterfall that easily accessible, but not that healthy nowadays due to construction of a dam above it. Situated in Thalawakele, main road to Hatton. If you are lucky enough to come on a rainy season with dam is open, this hidden jem can be seen again.
The little niagra of sri lanka. The place is so wonderful and the tea tasting at st. Claire's castle was a great experience plus their restaurant serves superb food :)

If you ever plan to be in Sri Lanka this should be on your bucket list. St. Clair's Falls is one of the widest waterfalls in this beautiful island. It is called the "Little Niagara of Sri Lanka" and is one of the most beautiful waterfalls in upcountry of Sri Lanka. It is located between Hatton and  Thalawakele and it is in a cooler area in this tropical country. It would be advisable to take a rain jacket or a spring jacket as it gets chillier in the evenings or could be raining often. As you are unable to get closer to the falls, it is ideal to have a pair of binoculars and also a zoom lens to take pictures. You should combine visiting Devon's falls and St Clair's on the same day as they are in the same area. Check review on Devon's too.
Subsequent to the upper Kothmale project the nice scenery from the main road to Nuwaraeliya is no more. During the dry spells it is only a narrow flow.
Don't go out of your way to see this waterfall.  It is on the side of the road.  The one at Horton Plains is more impressive.

excellent place to see the beauty of God's creation.  presently the roads are under upgrading therefore you will have a bumpy ride. If you are visiting St. Clari's falls you will also have the opportunity to see the Devon Falls which is on the same road
Now that the Kothmale Project is in full swing, the volume of the falls has depreciated. Its nothing compared to what is was a few years ago.
A fantastic sight on ur way up to nuwara eliya. It on ur left. Its beautiful even in the dry season. I think it would look spectacular wen theres plenty of water

Unfortunately, the level of water of the fall was very low when we visited the place. You can see this by the roadside when you travel from Colombo via Ginigathhena - Hatton to Nuwara Eliya. There's a foot path downhill, you can walk to an observation point much closer to the fall

situated 3 km west of the town of Talawakele on the Hatton-Talawakele Highway in Nuwara Eliya District. wonderful place to visit. really soothes you. photographers keep your gear ready when you are there.
